edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_2

Class ExpressionEvaluator

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_2.ExpressionEvaluator

  • public class ExpressionEvaluator
extends Object
    The ExpressionEvaluator will take in a string and will use two stacks, one to hold the operators and another to hold the arguments. It will then go through those stacks and evaluate the expression according to the precedence set. The expression it receives must have only numbers parentheses or the operators '+' '-' '*' or '/', and they must have spaces inbetween them all.
    Author:
    David Scianni

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Stack<Integer> args
      The stack args will hold all the argument values of the expression.
      private int currentParens
      The int currentParens will keep track of the current amount of parentheses when a multiplication or division is called before a parentheses.
      private boolean divParen
      The boolean divParen will determine if a division symbol was placed before a parentheses.
      private boolean lastIsDiv
      The boolean lastIsDiv will determine if the last operator that was sent was a division operator, so that it can evaluate the previous expression immediately.
      private boolean lastIsMult
      The boolean lastIsMult will determine if the last operator that was sent was a multiplication operator, so that it can evaluate the previous expression immediately, or after a division, if the next expression is a division.
      private boolean multParen
      The boolean multParen will determine if a multiplication symbol was placed before a parentheses.
      private boolean nextIsNeg
      The boolean nextIsNeg will determine if the next variable should be converted to a negative.
      private Stack<String> ops
      The stack ops will hold all the operator values of the expression.
      private boolean parsingNumber
      The boolean parsingNumber will determine if the item being parsed is a number or an operator.
      private int totalParens
      The int totalParens will help keep track of the total amount of parentheses in the stack.

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public int eval(String expr)
         throws InvalidEvaluationException
        The eval method will take in a string, will parse the string and then return the evaluation, which will be a number.
        Parameters:
        expr - The string that holds the expression.
        Returns:
        the number that is evaluated from the expression.
        Throws:
        InvalidEvaluationException - when an invalid expression is sent.

      • eval

        private int eval()
          throws InvalidEvaluationException
        The eval method uses recursion to evaluate the expression. It will solve all the addition, plus any multiplications that could not be solved in the parser.
        Returns:
        uses recursion to return the final number that results from evaluating the expression.
        Throws:
        InvalidEvaluationException - when an invalid expression is sent.

      • evalParens

        private int evalParens()
                throws InvalidEvaluationException
        The evalParens method uses recursion to evaluate the expression. It will solve all the addition, plus any multiplications that could not be solved in the parser. It will only be called when a ')' is found, and will run until a '(' is found, so that it solves everything in the parentheses.
        Returns:
        uses recursion to return the final number that results from evaluating the expression in the parentheses.
        Throws:
        InvalidEvaluationException - when an invalid expression is sent.

      • parseExpression

        private void parseExpression(String expr)
                      throws InvalidEvaluationException
        The parseExpression method will take in the expression and will take in every element of the expression and send it to get processed. It will process the first token first, in case it is a '-'. Then it will coninuously go through the rest. It will also check if there is a '*' because this is a special case. It deals with this because it has a lower precedence than the division, so it must check to make sure the next one isnt a '/', and if so, it will deal with the division first. Then it makes sure that it is a valid expression.
        Parameters:
        expr - The string that holds the expression.
        Throws:
        InvalidEvaluationException - when an invalid expression is sent.

      • processTailToken

        private void processTailToken(String token)
                       throws InvalidEvaluationException
        Used to process all the tokens that aren't the first ones.
        Parameters:
        token - the argument or operation that needs to be processed.
        Throws:
        InvalidEvaluationException - when an invalid expression is sent.

      • processFirstToken

        private void processFirstToken(String firstToken)
                        throws InvalidEvaluationException
        Used to process the first token.
        Parameters:
        firstToken - the first argument or operation that needs to be processed.
        Throws:
        InvalidEvaluationException - when an invalid expression is sent.

      • processToken

        private void processToken(String token,
                boolean isFirst)
                   throws InvalidEvaluationException
        This processes each token buy checking if it is an argument or an operation, and it will push the token in the correct stack. It will also deal with division, some multiplication, and parentheses by evaluating them.
        Parameters:
        token - the argument or operation that needs to be processed.
        isFirst - true if this is the first token, false if it is not.
        Throws:
        InvalidEvaluationException - when an invalid expression is sent.
